statement:
Let $M$ be a compact smooth manifold. There is a residual subset of
${\operatorname{Diff}}^1(M)$ in which every element $f$ satisfies
$\overline{{\operatorname{Per}}(f)}= \Omega(f)$. In other words:
Generically, the set of periodic points of a ${\mathcal{C}}^1$
diffeomorphism is dense in its nonwandering set.

Here, ${\operatorname{Diff}}^1(M)$ denotes the set of all
${\mathcal{C}}^1$ difeomorphisms from $M$ to itself, endowed with the
(strong) ${\mathcal{C}}^1$ topology.

[9]{} Pugh, C., *An improved closing lemma and a general density
theorem*, Amer. J. Math. **89** (1967).
